title: Krishna Kumar Shrestha
text:
With an unwavering passion for data analysis, I have forged a path of success in leveraging insights from complex information. As a devoted advocate for harnessing the power of data, I constantly seek opportunities to explore its depths and uncover valuable patterns. My dedication to the field is evident through my active involvement in the Actuarial Society of Nepal, where I contribute to the growth and advancement of data-driven practices. Through continuous learning and staying at the forefront of industry developments, I strive to make meaningful contributions to the world of data analysis and drive innovation in this dynamic field. Additionally, I have demonstrated my expertise in actuarial science and data analysis through various professional roles and projects, consistently delivering high-quality results and fostering a culture of continuous improvement and collaboration.



Tribhuvan University | Kathmandu, Nepal
Bachelor in Mathematical Science (Actuarial Science) | 2017 - 2021
Cumulative GPA: 2.68/4

Research Paper: Estimating R Number for Nepal: Key Indicator for Covid-19 Situation (Awarded as winner of Institute of Faculty of Actuaries hackathon 2021)
Relevant coursework: Predicting Air Quality of Kathmandu using SVM Model and Misinformation in Covid-19 Crisis
Certifications: Certified Data Analyst Professional (2023)
Achievements: Finalist in “Kislay Actuarial Education Hackathon 2020”




Actuarial Society of Nepal | Secretary | Kathmandu, Nepal | 07/2022 – Present - Spearhead the planning and execution of various training events, workshops, and seminars to promote continuous professional development within the actuarial community. - Strengthen the society’s outreach by coordinating with local and international actuarial organizations, building strategic partnerships for mutual growth and learning. - Represent the Actuarial Society of Nepal as a committee member in the GAIN Initiative (UNDP-Milliman).
Principal Risk Consulting | Senior Consultant | Kathmandu, Nepal | 12/2022 – Present - Lead and oversee Employee Benefit Valuation projects for a broad spectrum of clients, adhering to guidelines and standards set by Nepal Accounting Standard 19. - Provide guidance on regulatory compliance, risk management, and financial reporting related to employee benefit schemes to government organizations, public institutes, banks, and microfinance.
eBeema | Consultant | Kathmandu, Nepal | 06/2022 – 08/2023 - Successfully launched eBeema’s digital insurance platform, resulting in a significant increase in customer engagement and retention. - Led cross-functional teams in designing user-friendly mobile applications and web platforms for policyholders to easily purchase, manage, and claim insurance policies.
IME General Insurance | Senior Underwriter | Kathmandu, Nepal | 10/2021 – 06/2022 - Evaluated motor insurance and property insurance applications, policy endorsements, and renewals, ensuring accurate risk assessment and adherence to company underwriting guidelines.
Numeric Mind | Data Analyst Intern | Kathmandu, Nepal | 07/2020 – 12/2020 - Worked on data cleaning, tabulating data as per project specification, and conducting hypothesis testing for clinical trials using SAS and R programming.





R | Python | Excel with VBA | SQL | git



English | Nepali | Newari



Descriptive Analysis | Data Manipulation | Data Visualization | Predictive Modeling



Employee Benefit Valuation | IBNR Reserving | Own Risk Solvency



Written and Oral Communication: English, Nepali, Newari





Institute of Faculty of Actuaries (IFOA): CS1, CM1, CB1, CB2, CB3, CP3, Stage1
Data Camp: Data Analyst with R Track (77 hrs.), Data Scientist with R Track (88 hrs.)
World Bank Training: Risk Based Capital training, Own Risk Solvency training





Sports: Football and Cricket
Traveling: Especially hiking
Music: Especially lo-fi genre
